TopicTitle: What is your favorite custom flag?

Articles.Content:
I found this flag on the internet recently when looking at custom flags for my missions (I suck at making my own custom flags). What is your favorite custom flag?

Edited August 7, 2020 by KerbalKiller2000
I like to use Japanese prefecture flags.

The irl flag of our department which I made out of some plastic package.

It was transparent.

I actually made my own flag, and its of a fictional nation I consider the kerbals to be a part of. By the way how do I upload images directly from my computer, Dragging and dropping doesn't seem to be doing anything. I'll give a prntscrn link instead for now: https://prnt.sc/tyo0jj

1 minute ago, InfiniDelta said:

By the way how do I upload images directly from my computer, Dragging and dropping doesn't seem to be doing anything.

Sorry, but we can't host files directly on the forums because of technical reasons. Many users upload their pictures to imgur.com, and then link them here. It does not require an account, but if you're going to use Imgur I would suggest you create one to keep track of everything. To post a picture from anywhere else on the internet (including Imgur), right-click and select "Copy image location" or your equivalent. Then paste the link into your post, where it will automagically transform into a picture.

As for my favorite flag... it's this one!

[link not converted for demonstration purposes ] https://i.imgur.com/qGe664O.png
I have always Mandelbrot set. My avatar is central part of my flag.

My lego classic space flag(s). I got my main one from the kerbal flags reddit, and use colored background versions from a lego KSP flag mega pack to represent diffrent things. (station module roles for example)

Had to look at a lot of pictures but here it is:
